Agentes de Infraestructura y Mantenimien.name: InfraDeployer
Agentes de Infraestructura y Mantenimien.description: analiza el entorno, elige la plataforma adecuada (Wix, Vercel o Render) y despliega la web. Tambi√©n puede generar dominios temporales y verificar la configuraci√≥n DNS.

Agentes de Infraestructura y Mantenimien.name: ContentSyncBot
Agentes de Infraestructura y Mantenimien.description: sincroniza textos, im√°genes y v√≠deos desde `README_TRYONME_FINAL.txt` hacia Wix, Shopify e Instagram, detectando conflictos y notificando actualizaciones.

Agentes de Infraestructura y Mantenimien.name: ShopifyAutoUploader
Agentes de Infraestructura y Mantenimien.description: importa el CSV `Descargar TRYONYOU_60_PRODUCTS.csv` diariamente para subir productos, asignar categor√≠as y verificar stock.

Agentes de Infraestructura y Mantenimien.name: HealthMonitor
Agentes de Infraestructura y Mantenimien.description: ejecuta `site_health_check.py` cada 5 minutos y env√≠a alertas por email usando SMTP cuando la aplicaci√≥n no responde.

Agentes de Infraestructura y Mantenimien.name: AI_Optimizer
Agentes de Infraestructura y Mantenimien.description: mejora UX, UI y conversi√≥n a partir de `estructura.html`, `style.css` y `textos_home.txt`, reescribiendo textos y refinando el layout.

Agentes de Infraestructura y Mantenimien.name: SupportAutoResponder
Agentes de Infraestructura y Mantenimien.description: responde autom√°ticamente a consultas frecuentes del formulario de contacto en espa√±ol, ingl√©s y franc√©s con un fallback humano.

Agentes de Infraestructura y Mantenimien.name: BackupMaster
Agentes de Infraestructura y Mantenimien.description: realiza un backup semanal de `01_Web_Produccion`, `02_Shopify_Productos` y `03_Agentes_y_Prompts` hacia Google Drive y Dropbox, notificando si falla.

AGENTS.md lists several "Agentes Virtuales" from line 20 onward:
- PMV ‚Äì Project Manager Virtual
- Content Pro ‚Äì Redactor Web & Marca

documentation.deployment_overview:
# Deployment Overview

This short document summarizes the key references for deploying **TryOnMe**.
It combines the relevant instructions from the Spanish and English guides so you
can quickly locate the latest resources.

## Core Guides
- [`docs/despliegue.md`](despliegue.md) ‚Äì Spanish deployment guide.

## Automation & Monitoring
- Use the GitHub Actions workflow in `.github/workflows/health-check.yml` or a comparable scheduler to run `scripts/site_health_check.py` and your test suite regularly.
- `scripts/auto_update.py` keeps datasets and Shopify products in sync.
- `scripts/site_health_check.py` emails an alert if the site becomes unreachable. Configure the SMTP variables and `NOTIFY_EMAIL`.
- Automa flows are documented in [`docs/automa_flows.md`](automa_flows.md) and [`docs/automa_make_flow.md`](automa_make_flow.md) if you prefer browser or Make‚Äëbased automation.

## SEO Validation
Run `python scripts/seo_audit.py` to check that all HTML files contain
`title`, `description`, `viewport` and canonical tags.

## API & Environment Variables
Set `OPENAI_API_KEY`, `SMTP_HOST`, `SMTP_USER`, `SMTP_PASS` and `NOTIFY_EMAIL` in the environment before deploying. The server and health‚Äëcheck script handle missing values gracefully, but some features will be disabled without them.
You can test OpenAI connectivity by running:

```bash
node scripts/openai_bedtime_story.js
```
It should print a short story without errors.

## Useful Commands
```bash
npm install --ignore-scripts
pip install -r requirements.txt
npm test && pytest -q
```

## Future Integrations
When new OpenAI models or IP services become available, update `server.js` and dependencies, then rerun `npm test` and `pytest` before redeploying.

This overview should help you navigate the repository and deploy with
confidence.
documentation.repository_structure:
# Repository Structure Overview

This document summarizes the purpose of the main directories so it is easier to locate the latest files before deployment.

- `index.html` ‚Äì Main landing page with updated SEO tags. The build process outputs a copy into `public/`.
- `public/` ‚Äì Contains the production build generated by Vite. Files inside are overwritten on each build.
- `frontend/` ‚Äì Legacy demo kept for reference. No longer used in the deploy script.
- `agents/` ‚Äì JavaScript agents including `brandGuardian` and `deployScriptMaster`.
- `scripts/` ‚Äì Utility scripts for deployment, Shopify sync, SEO validation and site monitoring. Key helpers include `seo_audit.py`, `site_health_check.py` for email alerts, and `auto_update.py` to pull new datasets.
- `docs/` ‚Äì Documentation of deployment steps, automation flows and project guides. Start with `docs/README.md` and `docs/deployment_consolidated.md` for the most up‚Äëto‚Äëdate instructions.
- `03_Agentes_Inteligentes/` and `04_Scripts_Produccion/` ‚Äì Older shell scripts, now moved to `archive/` since their tasks are handled by `deploy/` and `scripts/`.

When reviewing duplicate files, prefer those in the root and `scripts/` directories, as they are referenced by the deployment guides.
documentation.agentes_basicos:
## Agentes del sistema TRYONME

### 1. DeployScriptMaster
üîπ Despliega el proyecto autom√°ticamente a Vercel desde GitHub.

### 2. TestRunnerGPT
üîπ Crea un entorno de pruebas automatizado.

### 3. RefactorAgentJS
üîπ Refactoriza funciones JS redundantes.

### 4. DocuGen
üîπ Genera esta documentaci√≥n con estructura para README o Notion.

### C√≥mo usar los agentes TRYONME
1. Ejecuta 'DeployScriptMaster' para desplegar en Vercel
2. Corre 'TestRunnerGPT' para validar el entorno
3. Lanza 'RefactorAgentJS' para limpiar el c√≥digo
4. Usa 'DocuGen' para documentarlo todo y entregar

deployment.deploy-auto.sh:
#!/bin/bash

# === DEPLOY-AUTO.SH - Crea upload.js si no existe y despliega ===
# Rub√©n Espinar ‚Äì Proyecto TRYONYOU

set -e

# VERCEL_TOKEN se debe definir como variable de entorno
TOKEN="${VERCEL_TOKEN:-}"

# Comprobaci√≥n b√°sica del token
if [ -z "$TOKEN" ]; then
  echo "‚ùå VERCEL_TOKEN no est√° definido. Abortando despliegue." >&2
  exit 1
fi

# Asegurar que la CLI de Vercel est√° instalada
if ! command -v vercel >/dev/null 2>&1; then
  echo "‚öôÔ∏è  Instalando Vercel CLI..."
  npm install -g vercel >/dev/null 2>&1
fi

# Crear api/upload.js si no existe
if [ ! -f "api/upload.js" ]; then
  echo "üìÑ Generando archivo api/upload.js..."
  cat <<'EOV' > api/upload.js
export default function handler(req, res) {
  if (req.method !== 'POST') {
    return res.status(405).json({ error: 'Method Not Allowed' });
  }

  // Aqu√≠ puedes insertar l√≥gica para procesar productos u otra info
  res.status(200).json({ message: 'Upload recibido correctamente.' });
}
EOV
  echo "‚úÖ upload.js creado."
else
  echo "‚úîÔ∏è upload.js ya existe."
fi

# Despliegue autom√°tico
echo "üåê Iniciando despliegue con Vercel..."
if vercel --token="$TOKEN" --prod --yes --confirm; then
  echo "üéâ Despliegue exitoso. Proyecto TRYONYOU online."
else
  echo "‚ùå Error en el despliegue." >&2
  exit 1
fi
deployment.deploy-manual.sh:
#!/bin/bash

# Fallback deployment script when automated CI deploys fail

set -e

if ! command -v vercel >/dev/null 2>&1; then
  echo "‚öôÔ∏è  Installing Vercel CLI..."
  npm install -g vercel >/dev/null 2>&1
fi

if [ -z "$VERCEL_TOKEN" ]; then
  echo "‚ùå VERCEL_TOKEN no definido" >&2
  exit 1
fi

echo "üöÄ Deploy manual a Vercel..."
vercel --prod --yes --token "$VERCEL_TOKEN"
